1.0.Text: I have to tell you something, little Hades: My relatives and I, we have been holding back one of our greatest gifts!! To see if you were worthy. And you are! My aid is yours, so call me if you need anything! Especially to smash your enemies to bits.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Lord Ares! Please accept this token of my deep appreciation for your generous support.

2.0.Text: An offering, for me? Indeed! How gracious that you keep me in your thoughts. Know that likewise I keep you in mine.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Lord Ares, please accept this offering, for giving me such strength as necessary to succeed.

2.0.Text: You are a flatterer, my death-inflicting kin. And I am feeling generous, as well, so here! A small token for you of my affection.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Lord Ares, it is my privilege to have met you, and have learned your death-inflicting way.

2.0.Text: I do appreciate this gift to me, although you really shouldn't have! The suffering which you inflict is ample compensation in itself.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Lord Ares, I honor you for all the strength you've given me to overcome my foes.

2.0.Text: Such a splendid offering, to me! How very thoughtful, there, my kin. I am taken aback, though I accept!

1.0.Text: I wished only to speak to you in private once again, my kin, except, you see...

2.0.Text: ...Except you see, dear Cousin, that some members of our family are predisposed toward the unspeakable. I caution you around my half-brother, is all. Now carry on.
2.0.Speaker: NPC_Athena_01

3.0.Text: You interrupt me once again, dear sister. You know I do not care for that. I warn you to stay out of my affairs. I shall aid my kin as I see fit.

4.0.Text: You only do as you see fit, Lord Ares. Mind that you continue pulling in the same direction as us all.
4.0.Speaker: NPC_Athena_01

1.0.Text: I so anticipate the day you finally arrive upon Olympus. There are few amongst us here with interests such as those I think we share.

2.0.Speaker: NPC_Aphrodite_01
2.0.Text: There are at least a few of us who share such interests here, isn't that so, Lord Ares? As for you, dearest, you take all the time you need!

1.0.Text: I trust the river-boatman Charon has been keeping plenty busy lately thanks to me?
I give to you this token of respect, buried though it must have been within the boatman's hoard.
The boatman Charon ought invest into a boat of more substantial size if he's to keep up with my work, my kin.
I knew that foul boatman would come through, and you would find amongst his wares this gift!
Do you suppose the dead feel pain unlike the living? This is for me an endless fascination, so go on, and give me more to think about.
The living and the dead alike desire what I represent. Their appetite for bloodshed cannot easily be sated. A goal to strive for, no?
I must say you deal death rather exquisitely. Though, perhaps I could be of some further assistance in such matters, yes?
Life and death are inextricable, and war is often what connects the two. Don't you agree?
I surely hope your bloodshed's going well, and long that there shall be no end to it. I am, as ever, here to serve your benefit.
Would that a sudden scourge of war would help you out of your predicament. Why, I would stir one up for you without a second thought.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: This one was bound to show up I guess. In the name of Hades! Olympus! I accept this message.

2.0.Text: You've got quite the fighting spirit in you there, I have to say. Most intriguing, and yet no surprise for someone born in hell itself. You come on out of there, and tell me all about it. I'm a fellow student of death, you see.

1.0.Text: Ah, I figured that you must have been the source of all that bloodshed underneath the earth. Let me see if I can make your death-dealing a little more efficient.
What say we start our next war with a special flair, my kin?
Ah, my favorite Underworld death-dealer. I so look forward to the pain you shall inflict this time around.
The devastation you have caused has not escaped my notice!
Not once has your Lord Father thanked me for delivering vast portions of his clientele. Surely you shall be more grateful for my gifts.
War needn't carry out solely above the earth, my kin.
The wretched dead you face perhaps forget themselves. Go, then, remind them of the agony which brought them to your realm.
Well, my hell-born kin, my blessing now is yours to do with as you wish; provided you inflict a little suffering for me?
Your father's realm shall be quite full, I think, once you and I are through.
My blessing be with you, and may death follow in your wake.
Perhaps my blessing shall let you deliver death still more efficiently.
I've just the thing for you this time, my friend. May I present my instruments of pain?
Beautiful, isn't it? The strife which follows you. You have a real knack for this, and I for one am happy to assist.
Please spread some suffering down there for me, my kin.
I've not seen ample blood spilled recently, so let's please make up for lost time.
How fares the ceaseless slaying of your foes, quite well, my kin?
The recent devastation which you caused, that was impressive work.
Let us together deal some death, shall we?
This world has a limitless capacity for pain; and so, it truly is no inconvenience to help you to bring out a little more.
There is no problem war cannot sort out.
We stand before a golden opportunity, to inflict pain. Let us proceed!
The finest instruments of death at my disposal shall be yours.
I shall empower you to acts of greater violence than before.
Some would question the destruction which you sow, but I shall never do so. I fully understand your impulses. Allow me to indulge them.
Shall we continue our campaign against the dead?
I trust that the destruction which you sow is going well?
As you continue waging war against the dead, I gladly lend you my support; family to family, no questions asked.
Death rears its head in all too many forms, I'm sure you know. Though you may never find them all, I nonetheless encourage you to try.
How fares your endless war against the dead? Let it be known that I am happy to take sides in such affairs. Please, I insist!
It is a veritable crime your father distances himself from all the rest of us. It is fortunate that you yourself are not so disagreeable.
I'd like to offer you a choice amongst my most exquisite tools which inflict suffering.
What do you say we bring the dead some pain, for old time's sake?
Whenever you bring death, why, you've my full support.
Perhaps the dead you stand against have long forgotten the experience of anguish and despair. I trust that you shall soon remind them for me?
Ah there you are, my kin! I have a gift to aid your bloody work.
Your choice leaves much to be desired here, my kin. My temper I shall keep in check, but only barely so.
You reject my generous offering of aid? Heh. You must not know me very well. Death shall come, regardless, either to your enemies, or you.
The whims of our kind are unpredictable, my kin. But you shall find responses to such acts to be the definition of consistency.
A disappointing choice, my kin, and there are consequences to such choices, every single time.
You would deny such aid as I would offer you? How rather disappointing. You've more to learn about the art of dealing death, it seems.
I'll not abide such disregard of our past companionship, my kin. In war, one must take sides, and you had best choose mine.
Your course of action here was ill-advised, my kin. For war shall come to you no matter what, as I shall presently reveal.
It seems unwise of you to thus dismiss my offering. Suffer, then, a while by my hand.
An incorrect decision, there, my kin, to side against me thus. Blood needs be shed, and yours is going to suffice.
What I could see of that display of violence you just sowed was thoroughly commendable, my kin. Then, here.
It is not often I attempt to kill someone and they survive. Bravo! Our score is settled up for now, so let us carry on as friends.
A sacrifice in blood is fully paid, and we are squared away. Though think you twice next time before you cross me, hm?
You capably survived my wrath, and I commend you for it. Let us continue on, as friends and kin.
A war can only last so long, my kin. This one is not worth the pursuit, I think, when we can wage a greater one, together.
You crossed the fields of death impressively back there. Though, you are fortunate I'm in a giving mood.
Your sacrifice to me just now has moved me to forgiveness for the time; thus shall we call a truce.
I think that we are squared away, for now. Though, do not test my patience further, hm?
When blood is spilled and death is dealt, I simply cannot remain discontented for too long.
Well haven't you withstood my murderous intent! Resilience as this deserves reward, and I am feeling rather generous.
You are a most impressive death-dealer, my kin. For by my estimation you have slain at least a thousand souls down there! Souls mostly having died before, but still.
Hm I see you have Lady Aphrodite's blessing there already. Love and death, together, hand in hand? Sounds most agreeable to me.
I sense that you have forged a greater bond with your instruments of destruction there, my kin. Then that is very good. And may their altered forms serve you quite well.
The winds of war blow fiercely on the surface now, my kin. Thus I am able to confer upon you even greater power than has been my custom.
Ah, you wield Coronacht, the Heart-Seeker. It pierced three Titans in one shot back in the war amongst our kind. Please do take care of it!
Ah, my kin, I sensed fresh bloodshed from you recently, the real kind! For you have slain the living near the surface, have you not? Mere vermin, yes, but good enough for me.
You bear the blessing of Athena, yes? She would protect you from your enemies, whilst I would rather that you slay them, and be done.
I trust that Thanatos is doing well? Although he brings to mortals merciful release, whilst I most certainly do no such thing, I do appreciate his take on it.
Ah, my kin, but you have suffered terribly to come this far. No matter, for we soon shall pay your enemies in kind.
The blessing of your uncle Lord Poseidon might have helped you to this point, but here: My gift shall see you further still.
The greatest wars require great alliances, my kin, and so I shall entrust to you some of the greatest methods of destruction I've devised thus far.
You have the Shield of Chaos, Aegis... quite unlike the one my good sister Athena likes to flash around. You have much better taste.
Our messenger Hermes has been in contact with you by now, yes? Perhaps you shall not see him very often, for my work keeps him rather preoccupied, sheparding souls and such.
Lord Zeus has gotten to you first, I see? My father's gifts are generous, indeed, though I think I can help in my own way.
Perhaps you know a god called Thanatos? The two of us are very close associates, you know. Do give him my best wishes should you see him soon.
You traveled rather far down there since last we met, my kin. And that means you have dealt incalculable death. I must commend you thus.
So Artemis my lonely half-sister got to you first? She merely helps you hunt, whilst I shall help you kill. Observe.
It is my understanding that you have grown rather close with Thanatos, my kin? A perfect choice of mate; though I confess I'd not expected Death to have affection for another save himself.
You are the son of Night herself, they say? A fascinating character. Ill-liked upon Olympus, although I myself have always longed to meet her.
That drunkard Dionysus cannot help you near as much as I, my hell-born kin. Compare the gift he gave to what I offer you.
Did you happen to know, my kin, that you have slain more than a hundred foes since you began your quest? You have, for I am keeping count. And I am most impressed!
Know that I admire your Lord Father very much. For his grim work lets me continue mine. I trust that one day you shall settle your dispute.
You bear Varatha, the Eternal Spear...! I thought it lost! Have you any idea how many lives it drank during your father's glory days?
Ten thousand souls have fallen to you, now, my hellborn kin. I am rather beside myself, I must admit. Fine work.
Why, you are wielding Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant! A most fascinating device. Imagine the new face of war, should its secrets someday be revealed, and spread to mortalkind!
You seem to be upon the verge of death, my friend. I cannot wait to hear of it! The experience of death, time after time! You are one of a kind!

I have to tell you something, little Hades: My relatives and I, we have been holding back one of our greatest gifts!! To see if you were worthy. And you are! My aid is yours, so call me if you need anything! Especially to smash your enemies to bits.
...You help him out again, you'll get a thousand lashes next we meet. And when I return, this little rock of yours had better be up there rather than here, or else you'll get a thousand more.

2.0.Text: Sounds good, sounds good, Madam, that's more than equitable really, I'll hold you to that! Be seeing you around!
2.0.Speaker: NPC_Sisyphus_01

1.0.Text: ...And you'll keep busy with your boulder if you know what's good for you, you little cheat. Don't go thinking I'm not watching you.

2.0.Text: I appreciate your vigilance, Madam, and surely I'll be getting Bouldy up this very hill in no time flat, despite the fact that I have never once achieved this!
2.0.Speaker: NPC_Sisyphus_01

3.0.Text: You've really never gotten Bouldy to the top before?
3.0.Speaker: CharProtag

4.0.Text: Never got the boulder to the top, not even once. Always tumbles down right at the very end. Lost count after the nineteen thousandth time or so, but you know what? One of these days, I bet it's going to stick.
4.0.Speaker: NPC_Sisyphus_01

1.0.Text: ...And, lastly, you're forbidden from offering further assistance to Prince Zagreus. Do we understand each other?

2.0.Text: I appreciate your vigilance, Madam, and surely I'll be getting Bouldy up this very hill in no time flat, despite the fact that I have never once achieved this!
2.0.Speaker: NPC_Sisyphus_01

3.0.Text: Enough. Get back to work, and I'll get back to mine.

1.0.Text: ...And, lastly, you're forbidden from offering further assistance to Prince Zagreus. Do we understand each other?

2.0.Text: I appreciate your vigilance, Madam, and surely I'll be getting Bouldy up this very hill in no time flat, despite the fact that I have never once achieved this!
2.0.Speaker: NPC_Sisyphus_01

3.0.Text: Enough. Get back to work, and I'll get back to mine.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Lord Ares! Please accept this token of my deep appreciation for your generous support.

2.0.Text: An offering, for me? Indeed! How gracious that you keep me in your thoughts. Know that likewise I keep you in mine.

1.0.Text: Lord Ares, please accept this offering, for giving me such strength as necessary to succeed.

{#DialogueItalicFormat}All is quiet at this time; ever-dreaming Hypnos put a spell upon the House, as willful Zagreus had asked of him. All are fast asleep, save for the Prince. It is exactly as he planned.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}The visage of the goddess Aphrodite now adorns the Prince's bedchambers, perhaps to provide consolation after when next he dies.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}The shattered weapons of the siege of Illion are now reduced to window-dressings in the Prince's ever-cluttered lair.

{#DialogueItalicFormat}A beautifully decorated, subtly enchanted bowl containing traces of the hapless Prince's past attempts to flee the Underworld now accents a particularly cluttered corner of his room.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}The fate-abetting Prince perhaps believes it was through his own choice that he procured the Fated List of Minor Prophecies, but it was preordained.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}The valor of the great-hearted Achilles is immortalized upon the Prince's wall, as though it might stir up more courage from within.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}The bedchambers of Prince Zagreus lie in a perpetual state of utter disarray, despite his Lord and master of the House repeatedly insisting that he pick everything up.
{#DialogueItalicFormat}It is the dead of night, or the approximation of it in the realm of Hades. Prince of the Underworld Zagreus rises from a fitful slumber, with much mischief on his mind.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Meg. Oh. I was not expecting company. Were you, just, casually snooping, or... is there something I can help you with?

2.0.Text: I was just leaving, Zagreus. Happened to be in the area, no thanks to you, and thought I'd go retrieve the last of my possessions. I have to say, you've really let this place go to hell.

3.0.Speaker: CharProtag
3.0.Text: ...She left. Great. Wonderful! I guess we'll just go back to killing each other repeatedly, then.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Forget another something in my bedchambers, there, Meg?

2.0.Text: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.

3.0.Speaker: CharProtag
3.0.Text: I'm sorry. My mother's out there, somewhere. I won't rest until I can find her. You wouldn't understand.

4.0.Text: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.

6.0.Text: I'm saying... I know you need to find your mother, Zagreus. I have my part to play in all of this, but let me see what I can do, if anything.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Forget another something in my bedchambers, there, Meg?

2.0.Text: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.

3.0.Speaker: CharProtag
3.0.Text: I'm sorry. My mother's out there, somewhere. I won't rest until I can find her. You wouldn't understand.

4.0.Text: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.

5.0.Text: Some of the pressure... wait, what are you going to do?
5.0.Speaker: CharProtag

6.0.Text: I'm saying... I know you're doing what you have to do, here, Zagreus. And, my sisters and I will always try to stop you. But I am only doing it because I have to. Understand?

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Meg... what a surprise. Again. What is it? ...What's the matter? Wait. Why are you looking at me like that?

2.0.Text: Zagreus, would you shut up already with your idiotic questions, and get over here? Right now.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: ...Whew, well, now, um, where was I...

2.0.Speaker: CharProtag
2.0.Text: Um, Meg, I... what I'm trying to say is, are you... are we good, or...?

3.0.Text: Stop being insecure around me, Zag. You should know better than that by now. Though, yes, if you must know... I think we're good. But if you tell another living soul, or even a dead one, I will kill you, understand?

4.0.Text: I... loud and clear, Meg, yes, I understand. So then... what happens now?
4.0.Speaker: CharProtag

5.0.Text: What happens now? I'll see you at the edge of Tartarus, I guess. Or maybe here. However long we keep this up.

6.0.Text: However long we keep this up?
6.0.Speaker: CharProtag

7.0.Text: You ask too many questions, Zag. I don't have the answers, and besides: You know more about living in the moment than I do. See you around.

1.0.Text: ...I... Meg, I'm deeply flattered, and you're very dear to me, it's just... this isn't what I want from our relationship. I fear I must have led you on. Forgive me. Please say you'll still be my friend?
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: ...You're sure? Look, I... it's totally all right. I'll see you out there, then.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: Meg... what a surprise. Again. What is it? ...What's the matter? Wait. Why are you looking at me like that?

2.0.Text: Shut up already, Zagreus. And come here.

4.0.Text: {#DialogueItalicFormat}Be with Megaera? (Either way, it will be OK.)

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: ...Whew, well, now, um, where was I...

2.0.Speaker: CharProtag
2.0.Text: Um, Meg, I... what I'm trying to say is, are you... are we good, or...?

3.0.Text: You ask too many questions, Zag. But yes, I'd say we are again, for now. But if you tell another soul, I'll kill you, understand?

4.0.Text: But... no, wait... not even Than...?
4.0.Speaker: CharProtag

5.0.Text: Than's not an idiot. He wants what's best for you. And he isn't the jealous type. Besides, I have a good working relationship with him, as you well know.

6.0.Text: Yeah, but... what about you, you're the punisher of jealousy. What if I...
6.0.Speaker: CharProtag

7.0.Text: We're not mere mortals, Zag. Mortals cling to one another viciously because their lives are short. What do we care? If Nyx has taught me one thing, it's that the heart has no bounds. Now quit your worrying, and get prepared for when we meet again out there. See you around.

1.0.Text: ...I... Meg, I'm deeply flattered, and you're very dear to me, it's just... this isn't what I want from our relationship. I fear I must have led you on. Forgive me. Please say you'll still be my friend?
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: ...You're sure? Look, I... it's totally all right. I'll see you out there, then.

1.0.Text: Thanatos...! I'd ask you to come in, but... you're already here. It's really good to see you.
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: Just tell me one thing, Zagreus. Did you really mean what you told me before, that... maybe we ought to... take our time?

1.0.Text: I just... don't mean to push you, Than. I know all this is kind of a lot. And I wanted you to know... this isn't some impulsive thing for me. I'll wait for you however long it takes.
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: {#DialogueItalicFormat}Khh! {#PreviousFormat}You have no concept of which impulses to act upon, and which to keep in check. You say you'll wait, well, let me ask you this: What are you waiting for? What are you waiting for, I'm here, already. Right...?

4.0.Speaker: CharProtag
4.0.Text: Hey, Than, look... speak up, already, I don't like it when you're quiet for too long, what's on your mind?

5.0.Text: A lot of things. And you will have to grow to like it, Zag. Or, what I mean is... don't take my silence the wrong way, all right? I'd better get going, though, I'm way behind on work, but... see you again. If that's all right.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: ...I did. Sometimes I need to slow things down. I'm thankful that we've been on better terms, lately. But, I've been coming on too strong. Forgive me. You're my dear friend. I don't want to do anything to hurt you. Or anybody else.

2.0.Text: You're certain? Well... I understand. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.

1.0.Text: Thanatos...! I'd ask you to come in, but... you're already here. It's really good to see you.
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: Just tell me one thing, Zagreus. Did you really mean what you told me before, that... maybe we ought to... take our time?

3.0.Text: {#DialogueItalicFormat}Go to Thanatos? (Either way, it will be OK.)

1.0.Text: I just... don't mean to push you, Than. I know all this is kind of a lot. And I wanted you to know... this isn't some impulsive thing for me. I'll wait for you however long it takes.
1.0.Speaker: CharProtag

2.0.Text: {#DialogueItalicFormat}Khh! {#PreviousFormat}You have no concept of which impulses to act upon, and which to keep in check. You say you'll wait, well, let me ask you this: What are you waiting for? What are you waiting for, I'm here, already. Right...?

3.0.Speaker: CharProtag
3.0.Text: Than... {#DialogueItalicFormat}hahaha{#PreviousFormat}, I'm so glad! It's just... you know that Megaera has been here, too...?

4.0.Text: {#DialogueItalicFormat}Tsch. {#PreviousFormat}I've known Megaera much longer than you. Who do you think talked me into this?

5.0.Speaker: CharProtag
5.0.Text: Hah! She did, did she? That's good! That's good.

6.0.Speaker: CharProtag
6.0.Text: Hey, Than, look... speak up, already, I don't like it when you're quiet for too long, what's on your mind?

7.0.Text: A lot of things. And you will have to grow to like it, Zag. Or, what I mean is... don't take my silence the wrong way, all right? I'd better get going, though, I'm way behind on work, but... see you again. If that's all right.

1.0.Speaker: CharProtag
1.0.Text: ...I did. Sometimes I need to slow things down. I'm thankful that we've been on better terms, lately. But, I've been coming on too strong. Forgive me. You're my dear friend. I don't want to do anything to hurt you. Or anybody else.

2.0.Text: You're certain? Well... I understand. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.
